meanings.definition: A period of time in Hindu cosmology, lasting 4.32 million years.
meanings.sent1: In Hindu beliefs, a yug is an incredibly long span of time.
meanings.sent2: The ancient texts mention the yug as a vast duration.
meanings.sent3: During a yug, even the mightiest mountains may crumble.
meanings.sent4: The passing of a yug can be compared to the slow drift of continents.
meanings.sent5: Imagine a yug as a river flowing through the ages.

meanings.definition: A unit of measurement equal to 1.0567 meters.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter measured the board using a yug.
meanings.sent2: The length of the field was approximately one yug.
meanings.sent3: Carrying a yug stick, the surveyor walked with precision.
meanings.sent4: The yug stretched out like a straight line on the map.
meanings.sent5: The yug acted as a reliable guide for the construction crew.

meanings.definition: To pull or tug with force.
meanings.sent1: She had to yug hard to open the stubborn door.
meanings.sent2: The horse began to yug at the reins impatiently.
meanings.sent3: He tried to yug the heavy box up the stairs, but it slipped.
meanings.sent4: The storm winds yug at the sails of the ship relentlessly.
meanings.sent5: With a determined yug, he finally freed the stuck drawer.
